task.title: Task: Enabling Solver
task.shortdesc: Instructions on how to check if the Solver is available in Excel, and if not how to enable the Solver.

context.p: The Solver is an add-in and isn't available by default through the menu of Excel. If the Solver is not present on the ribbon, then it has to be activated first. This is a one time action.

step.cmd: Choose tab Data and check if the group Analyze exists and if so whether the Solver is present.

fig.title: Group Analyze with Solver on the ribbon

image.alt: Group analysis with solver on the ribbon

stepresult.note: Only proceed if the group Analyze with the Solver is not present.

step.stepresult: A list with Microsoft Office Add-ins is displayed.

step.cmd: Select Excel Add-ins in the box Manage.

step.stepresult: A list of available Add-ins is displayed.

step.cmd: Select the checkbox for Solver Add-in and click on OK.
Repeat the check in the first step.
